titles.title: Personal Privacy Clarification Act
To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the personal privacy exemption in the Freedom of Information Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform .

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

committee.subcommittee: Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform
committee.name: House Oversight and Government Reform

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 1/26/2011--Introduced. Personal Privacy Clarification Act - Revises an exemption from the disclosure requirements of the Freedom of Information Act to apply to records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes to the extent that the production of such information could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of the privacy of any individual (currently, an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy).
